text: Lee Edward Evans (February 25, 1947 – May 19, 2021) was an American sprinter. He won two gold medals in the 1968 Summer Olympics, setting world records in the 400 meters and the 4 × 400 meters relay. Evans co-founded the Olympic Project for Human Rights and was part of the athlete's boycott and the Black Power movement. He was born in Madera, California. In 2011, Evans was diagnosed with a brain tumour. On May 15, 2021, Evans had a stroke and was hospitalized in Lagos, Nigeria. He died four days later, aged 74. ==References== Category:1947 births Category:2021 deaths Category:American sprinters Category:Olympic gold medalists for the United States Category:American civil rights activists Category:Sportspeople from California Category:Deaths from stroke
title: Lee Evans (sprinter)
